result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy J Lefebvere was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration
and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit 
of 51 days were granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to restitution for Kurt's Steak House. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow throught with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. Case 16CF173 was dismissed and read in.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Commencing forthwith. FIRST 60 days are Straight Time. Balance are non-working hours. Release for standard conditions.

records.addlTxt: Order Imposing 60 days Huber with 28 days credit from 05/25/18

Defendant Troy J Lefebvere in court, in custody.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Dan Pavelko from the Department of Corrections appeared.
Case called based on Mr. Pavelko's letter requesting condition time be imposed as an alternative to revocation.
Defendant verbally waives the alternative to revocation and will serve the condition time.  
60 days w/non working hours to commence May 25, 2018.    Defendant to receive credit for his straight time in custody since 5/25/2018 (28 days).  
Court signs order.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Troy J Lefebvere in court, in custody, with Attorney Matthew Huppertz.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Huppertz makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 51 days)
  -  1 1/2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $4,260.00 to Kurts Steak House (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($2,500.00) and remainder due as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 6 Months - 1st 60 days straight time and last 4 months non-working hours with standard release conditions.
 
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Dated 06/02/16, from Atty Huppertz to Judge Carter, with attached informatino for 06/09/16 sentencing hearing.
Order vacating bail forfeiture. Signed by Judge Carter on 05/04/16.
All postings.
Sentencing hearing on June 9, 2016 at 10:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Troy J Lefebvere in court with Attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.   Attorney Huppertz requests a sentencing date in 30 days.   Court vacates prior bail bond forfeitures.  Court revokes bail and orders Defendant held in custody until sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 10:30 am.
